title: Alvaro Morata plays down return to form after Atletico Madrid draw again
text:
Alvaro Morata shrugged off his recent upturn in goalscoring form after Atletico Madrid slipped up again by drawing 1-1 at Alaves.

Having scored just once in his first seven games of the season, Morata netted the opening goal in the Spanish top flight clash to take his tally to three goals in as many matches.

But his strike 20 minutes from time was cancelled out by former Arsenal and West Ham forward Lucas Perez in the 83rd minute, frustrating the visitors to a fourth draw in five La Liga games.

Alvaro Morata was left frustrated with Atletico Madrid's draw at Alaves despite scoring again

Morata's third goal from as many games opened the scoring in La Liga clash at Alaves

After the game, the former Chelsea striker admitted his improved record in front of goal is scant consolation to failing to hold onto three points.

'If I worried about myself I would play tennis,' he said. 'I'm as disappointed as everyone else is in the locker room.

'We had chances and we did not take advantage of them. For us, two points escaped us, but we also have to see the rest of the teams and what they will do on a trip as difficult as this one.'

Although Atletico laboured in their performance and were fortunate to strike late on, they could have wrapped the game up before Perez's equaliser with Morata wasting an opportunity to double his tally for the evening.

But Lucas Perez equalised in the 83rd minute to give Atletico a fourth draw from five games

Diego Simeone was left to reflect on another frustrating night for his Atletico side

Conceding late on denied Atletico the chance to go level on points with Barcelona at the top

However, manager Diego Simeone refused to blame his forward for the pivotal moment, choosing instead to praise Fernando Pacheco for a great save.

'The goalkeeper made a great stop, the ball was not going wide of the goal,' Simeone said.

'Alvaro was fine and the goalkeeper kept Alaves in the game because the match was over with the second goal.'
